reviews.text: Went to this location while coming back from San Diego. It is located right in front of busy gas station. It’s recently built so everything was new, nice and clean. Server was exceptionally helpful and food which we ordered was good. For sure, will stop by again whenever I am in that area or traveling to San Diego again. Next time I will click picture and upload it here.
Great service.  Great food. Came at 500 a.m. so they were not busy

Overall good, not great.
Customer service was lacking somewhat. Drink refills took longer than normal and so did ordering. Food tasted like it should.
Staff interactions and layout of interior was nice.
The breakfast was good but they serve coffee in dirty cups. It makes you wonder what else is dirty in their kitchen. We didn't leave a tip and will not go there again.
The food was good along with great service. Enjoyable stop on our way back home to Vegas.

Good food.  Reasonably priced. The shrimp special was delicious.  But the wife's steak came out under-cooked.

A few mistakes were made with the service, hence the lower rating.  But this is a better choice if you're in the neighborhood.

We love Logan's decided to stop while coming home from vacation,  grilled mushrooms was still cold and uncooked. I did end up returning my pile high french dip, it was the outer part of the roast one half of the sandwich 1/3 of the meat was uneatable the other half was uneatable they removed it from the bill and made me a new one but it should of never made it out of the kitchen.

I am a truck driver and our terminal is practically next door. As a reward to myself I come here EVERYTIME  I am in town. Probably not again. 
It took 10 minutes for the waitress to even acknowledge my existence, ordered my usual meal and a side salad. Over a half hour goes by and out comes my steak..... no salad... no big deal just asked them to forget the salad(appetizer) when I cut into the steak which was ordered medium it was medium well, almost well done.
So long story short, I know as a server you hate single diners but we eat too and a little secret we usually tip quite well. ( at least I do)
So pay attention to the big parties and keep ignoring your loyal customers.
Now I guess it's off to find food.
Great food. Our waitress was great but she had no one else helping her so she was everywhere. Still did a decent job.

This place is such a joke. Never have I seen such a poorly managed place. This is the second time it has happened where they have like twelve empty tables but they refuse to sit people because their kitchen is backed up or whatever. I mean seriously? Let's have people stand up and not even get drinks because our back of the house is poorly run? If they weren't the only place in Lookout Valley they'd be closed. The managers need to go work in another industry because they don't understand service.

Then it gets worse. We're finally seated, and we're seated as far away from TV's as possible. We ask can't we just sit at one of those other 12-15 empty tables closer to a TV. The hostess says she will check, then she comes back and says no. What is going on with this place?

In the end I decided they weren't worth my money and we just ordered drinks until the game was finished and went and ate somewhere else. That is how bad the customer service was here, I decided I would rather drive somewhere else to eat just to deprive them of revenue I felt they didn't deserve.

Hostess took her time sitting us. Left people waiting over 20 min. One lady left because she only had one hour for lunch. If she had moved any slower they would of buried her. Our waiter was the best. He checked with us often and made sure all his tables were happy!

Not a great brunch place, but those skinny potatoes kicked butt.  Nice servers.  The veggie omelette had huge chunks of broccoli in it. I wouldn't have ordered it if the menu mentioned broccoli. Luckily my wife swapped plates with me.  Stick to the menu please, don't substitute and not ask me.  And my goodness, chop up the broccoli a bit.

My overall experience last night was awful, and I can say with all honesty that I won't be visiting here again. 

The restaurant was not busy, however, it took a long time to seat myself and my daughter. The server took an incredibly long time just to take our drink orders, and another 15 minutes to take the food orders. I'll be honest, I wasn't born with a highly superior autobiographical memory, and neither was our server, but she attempted to take our order without writing it down. I ordered the steak and salmon well done and a cheese pizza for my daughter. The food comes out, and
and there are chicken strips and steak. The server takes the chicken strips off of my plate (I hope they don't recycle the food) and goes to the back. I then cut into my steak and it is medium well. They discounted the meal, but I was so displeased. It was all wrong. I won't be returning here, ever.

Flavor was spot on but temperatures were way off. Cold, hard undercooked potato,  Luke warm broccoli and a tepped fatty steak. Could have been excellent,  but from the lack luster greeting at the door it should have been a sign that things are not managed well. I sat facing the "to go" counter and felt deeply sorry for the folks thinking they were going to grab and go. There was an average wait time of 25 minutes.  Saw people dress like managers but we were never approached or greeted by one.
Nice and clean. The only reason they get a four star is because they did not greet me when I entered. If this food was for me I would not have bought it, I would have took my money elsewhere.

Are you kidding me? I called ahead for 12 people 5 of them being small kids. I had to wait another 45 minutes after the call ahead time to get seated and I repeat with 5 small children. Are you kidding me? Is the call ahead not done for that particular reason that I don’t have to spend an hour waiting for a table with small children? I don’t understand. The host not only is standing there giving me an issue but also making comments about how he can’t do anything. Perhaps you shouldn’t be making a call and head if you cannot accommodate. Disgusting! Very disappointed my last time here.

Excellent service that evening and the steaks were cooked to perfection. I strongly recommend people tell them to leave their seasoning off because it really ruins s a good piece of meat.  I loved that the sweet potato was not in foil so it was actually a sweet potato and not pudding.  The New York strip was amazingly tasty for the price. Our waiter was really on top of things and kept our glasses full and kept checking to see if we were satisfied. The salads were very fresh and tasty. I do recommend the wedge salad because it is excellent and a good value.

Wow Wow Wow. Had a great meal. Service was outstanding.  The waiter Michael was a step above all before.  We both had a special.  Lobster tail and Sirloin - and - Lobster tail and Crab Cakes and Shrimp skewer. A couple beers and the Awesome brownie.  Looking forward to going back and asking for the same waiter Michael!

I tried something new this visit and had the Pork Porterhouse. It was cooked perfectly, properly cooked and still juicy. It was very savory and I was very happy with my selection. The waiter, though he got our order correct and sufficiently attentive, while he was standing in front of our table seemed like we were keeping him from something more important. It was a typical Outback, so nothing to write home about with the decor. We were seating at the first booth from the lobby, so we saw quite a bit of foot traffic. In general, a nice meal with the delicious piece of pork being the best thing of the night.

Terrible experience yesterday. 3:45 in the afternoon and half the restaurant is empty! We were told to wait for 40 minutes until a waiter came on duty to wait on us🙄😡
So we left and went to Texas Roadhouse where we received amazing treatment with excellent customer service. 
We will not go back to Outback ever!!

As soon as I walked in, I was greeted with a happy smile! Although when it came time to order, I had to wait since there was only one person working the cash register (even though there were a lot more behind the register area although I am not sure what they were doing). I got the broccoli cheddar soup which was of course delicious and I sat by the fire. It was peaceful. I will definitely come back to this panera in the future!

They rarely get orders correct. Today my salad was missing the chicken, they asked if I wanted to come back to get it, really! Don't they teach their folks that prepare the food to actually read their computer screens? They managed to not put the red onion on the salad but no chicken.

We order from Panera on Reed Hartman regularly for our company lunches. Have always loved the food. Last time we ordered, there was a hair in one of our soups. Two of us ordered the same soup. Needless to say it really made our stomachs churn and ruined lunch for all five of us that had ordered. I called to speak to a manager. The woman that answered the phone was beyond rude. She had no idea what I was calling for and said "they too busy to speak to you". Mind you, I could have been calling for catering info because I had not given my reason for calling yet. When I insisted on needing to speak to a manager, the delivery manager got on the phone. I explained everything. She apologized and said "Your next delivery order will be comped. I'm putting it in the book." (I didn't ask her to do this.) So we called today to order and spoke to the delivery manager who said she could only comp the cup of soup. Since that is not what she told me, I asked to speak to the GM who proceeded to say that they can only comp the soup. I asked if they record their calls -- they don't. Picture of the hair in the soup below. They need to learn about good customer service because we ordered regularly from them not only for a few of us but for team lunches to be catered in as well and we will not be doing that anymore. I don't normally complain. I never leave bad reviews but this is ridiculous. I didn't ask for our entire order to be comped, they volunteered it and then didn't honor it.

Outstanding experience during the lunch rush.

The line was to the door, but the staff and management kept the service flowing and my food came out perfect.

Very nice facility with plenty of seating, much above average for a Panera. Well maintained and clean.
This is an ok Panera Bread. It's pretty much what you would expect. The place is nice, clean and the staff is friendly. Other than that there is nothing too special about the place.

The food is awful, the chips are over cooked. The meat is cheap and not cooked in the sauces. The sweet and sour does not taste like any sweet and sour I have ever had it has a mildly unpleasant flavour
The worst Chinese food I've ever tried to eat.. tatesless and way over cooked. Chicken was hard, curry sauce was terrible.. the duck spring rolls were worst thing I've ever tasted.

Ordered a chicken noodles and beef fried rice with pot of curry sauce...... can safely say it was a huge mistake ordering from this place.... chicken actually tasted like it was off the noodles somehow where chewy and the curry sauce was a pure taste of salt!! Chinese has to be my favourite food but 100% this was the worst I have had!!

This was absolutely awful and by far the worst chinese I have ever had. We tried China town for the first time 6 months ago and were disappointed. We thought we would give them one more go. I'm not a fussy eater, but this was inedible. I couldn't even tell what the meat was suppose to be.

Decided to try Chinatown Takeaway because the other local Chinese takeaway was closed... Error!! Not only are the portion sizes much smaller and the quality a lot lower but, they also messed up the order by forgetting to deliver an item. The delivery chap returned with the missed item & then came back a third time claiming we hadn't paid for it..! Upon calling the Chinatown takeaway, they admitted fault but still expected us to pay the "debt collector" they had sent to our door! Avoid Chinatown and got to Beijing Paradise, it's much better all round!!

Just like the one at home. They have huge screens and are a good size for large parties. They can accommodate a large group. Please call in advance for large parties. Good selection at the bar, all your favorite drinks and some local brew. I went back the next day and was treated just as good. I liked the service and the staff was really trying to get me everything I asked for.

The food is set by the company, and the back end fulfills their end of the deal by making great, casual food. However, the front end customer service leaves something to be desired. Too long to come back to table. Little menu knowledge (this has been on three occasions in the past month). If you want to watch the game and dont care about customer service, then 5 stars.
The patron was very attentive and very helpful. The appetizers were delicious and the pulled pork sandwich could have used less salt but overall good. There were no images due to the gobbled up food.
The food was good but what made the experience even better was our server!! She was amazing... just wished I could remember her name.  I would hire her in a heartbeat

Atmosphere is their main attraction. The wings are ok. Let's face it you go for the drinks and sports.  However the burger never disappoints.  Bloody Mary could use some tweaking.  I've had better. Can't mess up the draft drinks. Service is slow so order a drink before you get to the glass half-empty.

Love walking into a Starbucks and smelling the fresh coffee. This location was clean and the staff friendly. Coffee was made to order and correctly made for this picky coffee drinker lol. This spot has an area for when you are wanting to socialize or break out the computer/books and do some studying while sipping on a latte. Only problem I seen was the drive through and parking area are very tight but couldn't take a star away just for that. Keep it up at this location cause my little girl and I will definitely be back for our coffee.
Always fast, friendly, and informative! Their coffee is great and their snacks are always yummy! Mobile pickup through their app is always very convenient as well!

Yummy but prices need to stop going up, they  are beyond being a very successful business that has millions of people addicted and stopping for ine of their many yummy beverages and foods almost every day like its crack, stop being greedy with the cost increase of everything, PLEASE. I want to be able to afford my coffee "crack" lol just playing, kinda. Attention there's no illegal drugs served at any Starbucks facility
... that I'm aware of!
Very friendly service. Got the order correct. Fast.
Rude, impersonal staff, slow service, dirty restrooms. The food is blah, you get better quality food at much lower prices at McDonalds or any of the other fast food chains in the area.
